labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed to retrieve transcripts from YouTube videos using its primary tool, "get_transcript". This functionality falls under retrieving and processing textual data from video content, which aligns closely with content extraction and information gathering.
labels.reasoning: The primary function of extracting transcripts makes this server highly relevant to content creation and research activities. The "Web Search & Research" label is chosen because transcript retrieval enables users to analyze video content more efficiently, similar to how a search tool might gather textual information. "Content Creation" is a secondary label because the extracted transcripts can be repurposed or analyzed for content generation. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately cover the functionality.

tools.name: get_transcript
tools.description: Retrieves the transcript of a YouTube video.

url.description: The URL of the YouTube video
url.title: Url

lang.description: The preferred language for the transcript
lang.title: Lang

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@jkawamoto/mcp-youtube-transcript/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
